meanings.definition: The act of completing or making something whole.
meanings.sent1: The complementation of the puzzle brought a sense of satisfaction.
meanings.sent2: The complementation of flavors in the dish made it delicious.
meanings.sent3: The complementation of colors in the painting was visually pleasing.
meanings.sent4: The complementation of skills in the team made them unbeatable.
meanings.sent5: The complementation of ingredients in the recipe created a perfect balance.

meanings.definition: The process of adding something to enhance or improve another thing.
meanings.sent1: The complementation of spices elevated the taste of the soup.
meanings.sent2: The complementation of accessories completed her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The complementation of music with the fireworks display was magical.
meanings.sent4: The complementation of knowledge and experience led to great success.
meanings.sent5: The complementation of flavors in the sauce made it irresistible.

meanings.definition: The relationship between two elements that combine to form a whole.
meanings.sent1: The complementation of the melody and lyrics created a beautiful song.
meanings.sent2: The complementation of teamwork and communication led to a successful project.
meanings.sent3: The complementation of the key ingredients made the dish unforgettable.
meanings.sent4: The complementation of sunlight and water is essential for plant growth.
meanings.sent5: The complementation of colors in the design made it eye-catching.
